snippet: The exoneration of two North Carolina men provides a textbook example of so much that is broken in the American justice system.
abstract: Editorial asserts that exoneration of North Carolina men Henry Lee McCollum and Leon Brown, who spent 30 years in prison on rape and murder charges, provides textbook example of what is broken in American justice system; notes lack of evidence, confessions made under duress and official error and misconduct in case; says men's exoneration also shows that death penalty is irretrievably flawed, and calls for its end.
lead_paragraph: The exoneration of two North Carolina men provides a textbook example of so much that is broken in the American justice system.
